positive.review: This game reminds me of all those educational games for kids from 2005. Anyway, itâ€™s not bad for some casual clicking

Having played this game since 2022, after the recent Reality Reboot update I feel it's finally time for me to quit. With that, I'm not saying the game is bad (I did, after all, get over 10,000 hours on it, most of it idle, though), nor that the new update itself is bad. However, it made me realize I wasn't truly enjoying the game anymore, rather just going through the motions, having reached the endgame before the update. With the prospect of having to "restart", and I put that in quotation marks because I didn't actually lose progress, I came to the conclusion that the game was no longer for me. At any rate, let's get to a proper review now.

Cell to Singularity is an idle game. If you're unfamiliar with the term, it's a genre of games in which you basically watch numbers grow, like Cookie Clicker, to mention one of the most famous examples. The main gameplay loop is that you start by clicking and earning resources that way, which you then use to buy generators, which generate resources on their own. As you unlock better generators and upgrades, you generate more and more resources, and the "objective" of the game is basically to unlock everything.

This game's "flavor", to give it a name, is that of evolution, as you start with Earth, early life, and work your way up through all of evolution, including the human species, and even further than that. On top of that, there's three extra modes: the Mesozoic Valley, which is all about the dinosaurs; Beyond, in which you deal with celestial bodies; and finally, Explore, which is a rotation of different themed events. At the end of the day, it's all just flavor text for the same basic gameplay loop, but I'll give this game props for being semi-educational, as each generator, upgrade and achievement includes a brief description with some interesting fact or trivia about it.

I don't think there's much more for me to say about this game, even given my extended playtime. Graphics are pretty simple, and it makes sense, since it's also a mobile game (there's microtransactions, too, but they aren't really needed to progress), but it looks good and stylized. The soundtrack is also nice, although given its idle nature, you'll eventually end up turning it off.

Do I recommend it? Maybe, if you want some background game to check between proper gaming sessions.

Fun game and I wish there were more of its kind. We need more educational games.

I do wish it was a bit more educational for those that want it, it has nice short descriptions of things, but could offer more for those that want it. 

Secondly I don't agree with the philosophy of the primary simulation, first off it leaves out plant life completely (maybe they'll make a separate one?), and explains advances such as agriculture away as human ingenuity when in reality we owe much of it to other factors (a settling, steady climate in the case of agriculture). I just thinks it lacks nuance in that sense. Have not made it to the Singularity bit yet but obviously that's also questionable.

Finally, the actual game aspect feels a bit poorly balanced. The engine building doesn't really work all too well when some upgrades cost way more than they'll ever produce and also no, I don't want to click my screen until I get a muscle injury.

With all that said, the game is a nice and relaxing/satisfying way to learn new things and that will always be good in my book.

Many cell to singularity fans have been long anticipating this update, as have I. I've only played for about 6 months, but within that timeframe i managed to get all steam achievements, get almost every single in game achievement, fully max out primary simulation, beyond simulation, and mesozoic simulation. I love this game to death. So when you fully learn what the game has to offer, get used to every menu, simple color schemes, icons, models, you grow attached and accustomed to it. But this update which revamped the entire primary simulation changes everything.

If you read the logs, you'll find out the basic stuff about this update, but the truth is, they didn't tell you everything that this update has to offer. So many things have new icons and colors, they added so many new life form evolutions which speed up your primary simulation in unique ways. Theres just so many new things that I'm surprised at every corner of the game I look. I currently am sick with covid-19, but even that won't stop me from enjoying this update. From the desktop icon from the game, to new branches, to the nanobot icons, everything new and revamped is just so lovely.

 I look forward to the promising future of cell to singularity. Thank you computer lunch, for making this game. It's helped me during a really rough patch in my life. luv u <3

This game is more than a simple clicker. It's like virtual encyclopedia. An easy transfer of your save files from mobile device to PC version via cross-platform feature. Forced ads are absent. Couldn't find any disadvantage in this game, besides... maybe... updates come slower than we want.
amazing and fun game to play, especially when you are watching something else on the background.

Good game, but overtime gets repetitive, it can offer a lot of learning tho, if you are just beginning to learn about biology and evolution.. Other than that its really an idle clicker, and yes it kept idling for 200 days. There is quite a grind curve if you want to progress quickly. 

Graphics and all that are nothing special 

I would recommend to anyone that wants to learn something or maybe just have a bit of fun progressing through this game.

I like this game for how beautifully made this is, and that the team is constantly improving it, my favorite simulation is the Beyond, as I find astronomy interesting, and this is a way for me to satisfy my curiosity.
The events are also a nice touch.
The recent Beta Test is a good remake of the old version and should be kept this way.

Generally, a good clicker game. Unlike everything in the entire universe, it will not crash my computer. However, i would not recommend it if you want to set it up so that you can play on the same save for both mobile and computer.
It's a clicking game, just like it says. It's a fund progression through evolution and along the way. Soothing. Great background game.

This game is very fun, the progression might seem slow at first but after a while, it can be pretty easy to get to singularity. I also enjoy all of the events that happen regularly, although I do wish we didn't have to restart from scratch every time they ended. This game is also good for learning about evolution and biology.
good idle game that actually teaches you things. i like how you choose when it resets or not, and the science stuff is pretty sweet too.

Been playing this game for a while now (yes concerning playtime) and aint it fun, its like a tiny fun encyclopedia of sorts
Just trivia facts being thrown at you. I love and hate the grindy bit especially for the beyond. Had nearly finished the game then the reboot happened and its real fun, many new objectives to look forward to
Simple clicker game that gets frequent updates. Enjoyable experience so far.
A very unique clicker and a very good free game. Recommend if you like things like Biology, Palaeontology or just Science in general, and clicker games. Also brilliant jokes for each level up.
This game is addicting and satisfying. And it's constantly changing. It's incredibly well fleshed-out for a game that can be played completely for free.
Good for my Biology class, really helps me with my homework and understand the molecules and cells.

Not bad, I like the linear progression opposed to some stupid system where I have to min/max. It's as simple as "click, get upgrades, click more to get more upgrades to click better." One suggestion though, add an option to turn off the tapping sounds separate from the volume slider. I want to turn off the tapping sounds without turning down the rest of the game.
Even though it is a very entertaining and stimulating game, it also teaches you many, many things. Also you can advance through the game without spending any money
Very addictive and satisfying gameplay, even when progress is slow.
a good idle clicker game. it may looks like a moblie game, most of the item can get from playing through. the pay to win system is more balance than an actually 3A games.

I mainly play on mobile (Its a lot easier on it) which is why I haven't played for so long, but the game is a lot of fun. (I only really did this review for so I could complete all the steam award tasks)

An idle game with an educational bent as you learn the very basics of terran and stellar evolution and watch numbers get bigger and bigger. Sits in the background and doesn't seem to hog too much power. Lots to uncover, and a good way to fill a few minutes each day.
A very fun (and slightly addictive) game that lets you learn in an engaging way about life, science and the universe.

I've played this game practically every day since I first found it! The developers are always coming up with new ideas, expanding the development trees, and creating new short-term challenges. That's why I've nominated it for the Labour of Love Award in the 2025 Steam Awards. For a free game, this really is a labour of love from the Cells team.
Incredible good idle game, my second favorite right next to cookie clicker.
Good game with goood enaugh impact on to understanding world
The events are fun and interesting and the game also has a teaching aspect.
Some of the best parts of all the old Sim (Maxis) games from way back in the day. 100% recommend
for a free game at lest it isint pulling me to pay as much as other games do.
It really relaxes me and the classical music choices top tier
very great and chill clicker game to pass time if your bored.
this is a great idle game and i love those but endgame is a little grindy and confusing

Excellent click-based adventurer that demonstrates standardized evolution alongside unique timed-based events.

My only complaint: Monetization is heavily bent toward invested players, and preys on that fact with extreme prices for limited in-game currency and buffs.

Overall for it being free - you can still have an enjoyable time at a much more mild pace, even without actively playing! After a certain amount of days have past, you can easily click through a wide section and enjoy the information provided and the resulting "growth" of each branch. I recommend! :)

Cell to Singularity is one of those deceptively simple idle games that quickly becomes something moreâ€”an unexpectedly thoughtful tour through the history (and future) of life, science, and intelligence. What begins with tapping to generate a few points of â€œentropyâ€ slowly unfolds into a sprawling evolutionary tree, from primordial soup to complex organisms, human civilization, and eventually speculative post-human futures.

Unironically one of the best educational games out there, the content is extremely high quality and indepth and the feeling of progression is insanely gratifying
People complain about the premium currency and p2w and all that but you get tons of darwin cubes for no cost and you never need them at all anyway lmao, I'd argue going out of your way to pay for them makes the game worse since the slow, hard-earned progression and many many rewards you get for through it are so much better when you know you did it yourself and theyre well-earned, instead of just skipping all of it and having it mean nothing (the explore events are honestly kinda BS though)
So many educational tidbits crammed into this game, so much to do you never run out, and the reality reboot update is actually pretty insane
what a great game, i love space
After years and hundrets of hours, they still bring updates to this game. The name of the game truely capsulated by the devs at it seems the evolution of Cells is never gonna end.

Wonderfully educational game. Simple and can always go back to it when you want to. The folks who made this always seem to update every year which gives this a game a fresh feel. There are also timed events for those wanting a little extra to their game. Recommend!

Been playing for years and the progression actually feels good throughout. Especially after the reality reboot update, the economy has been better and there's a lot more upgrades to shoot for. New events are always great to get badges for and always make the next event faster. There's leaderboards if you're interested and I like how you can play across mobile and web versions in 4 different simulations. Finally 100%-ed this after hitting prestige 48 in Jurassic across about 2,000 hours including afk. UPDATE: 21 NEW ACHIEVEMENTS ADDED as of Thanksgiving 2025. It has a great style and a great soundtrack and for some reason has a collab with a roblox game that gives you a badge. I love the educational style that this game presents itself as and it depends what you want to get out of this game. It's very nice for something casual to grab some daily rewards, break up the monotony and see the number get bigger like Cookie Clicker.

I have put many hours into this game, on Steam and on Mobile. While it looks like just another idle/clicker game, it's actually quite a bit more than that. Regularly updated, lots of special events, no nagging or pay-to-win microtransactions needed to progress; it is a gem in the idle/clicker genre.
Educational game and music is markable

very good game, very informative and fun
you can play it for a long time without getting bored

Reboot became the most addictive idle game i ever played. Every time is "one more metabit or knowledge goal.
And very liked darvinium boost. Now i can use x4 almost all the time without donate.
This game is awesome. It's a great thing to just have on in the background while you do other things. Big numbers make brain happy. I just got the new update, and I love it already.
this game is super good and i got the infinty pass for 3 days free since i have been here since the preboot era
Can be rather addicting, personally having a autoclicker makes this game much more fun

Best enjoyed on Mobile
Maybe it's just my computer being very low quality, but with the new update the game has crashed repeatedly
Still though, it's a pleasant experience, like a friend you see once or twice a week

In the process of learning medical chemistry and the new found appreciation of evolution, I've become obsessed with this game. I love the new update and how the devs put it into the lore of the simulation. 10/10

Lol, don't listen to the guy complaining about "Roblox Numbers", you can change that in the settings really easily. this is a 9/10 Idle game. I'd say some of the game mechanics aren't for everyone, like if you prefer something like cookie clicker. also no stupid Idle time caps like some other games I've played
Surprisingly good, educative and addictive game
Solid clicker especially considering it's free. The microtransactions aren't shoved in your face and it brings some interesting gimmicks to the table.
p interesting to read and learn abt stuff. Event gameplay is p tough to get 3 badges.
Have fun then it gets too grindy so you forget about it for 3 years, come back have 1.2 sextillion money and have fun again till it gets too grindy and forget about it another 3 years
Awesome game that allows you to learn something about our world and its past, love it!

I have played this game for years, i want to say for as long as its been out. From on the cell to on the computer I am always re-downloading this game. I have learned this game like the back of my hand. I found that it is wonderful in ways of exposing the mind to educational materials in ways that are pure game format. I love the events that are put on, it is always something actually interesting being put on. I absolutely love the occasional infinity pass reward. I wouldnt ever be able to purchase it on my own but i do like that reward. Very rewarding game all around 10/10.
its a really fun game, one of my friends recommended this game to me and ive played it and its quite good

Great depth, felt almost educational. One of the most information-packed games I've played, and had already gone through the game on mobile before starting here. Great game to add to the "Perfect Games"-collection
An ambitious incremental game that simulates the entire history of evolution, from the first cell to the technological singularity and beyond into the cosmos.

Pretty fun Idle game. Got all steam achievements at just over 1k hours. Still more in-game achievements and grinding to do afterwards. Will probably keep picking away at them as the game itself is just fun in general. I also like the multiplayer events that pit your single-player simulation against others but it's all optional and no need to complete past collecting badges to make your own sim stronger. Good stuff.
Didn't play too much, but game is okay, I guess.
Fun, good stuff, love the new update. i'm excited for what's to come!
you do need a auto clicker if you want to go faster but the rest not that fun but you can learn stuff you didn't know before you should play if you want
i love this i am still going to episode 30 in beyond but i love the game and also i love space
jobless? feeling bored? want to waste your time rather than doing something productive? then this game is for you
its very addicting and fun
for people that likes fields like science or maths

This game is really unique and keeps you hooked for hours on end

negative.review:
I got to play this before the 11/18/2025 purge

Game was very fun and addicting. 

And then the purge happened.

- Cubes to unlock things no longer spawn and replaced by other things 
- Number system was replaced from Million and Trillion to the stupid roblox style of numbers "Aa Ab Ac" 
- Progress was reset in main map so you have to unlock everything again. Option to stay on your original main map if you want but who will do that... 

Feels like developer took a "how to monitize your game" class and started bleeding our pennys from us. Even gave us a free limited time upgrade to x2 what we earn only to have it end in a few days and try to force us to buy more out of feeling slow. 

Just killed your game. Bye~ 

PS no reason to respond to this Mr Developer. You will say a lot of "We feel sorry you feel this way but can earn unlock cubes in many new and exciting ways!" Don't bother. We see right through your new scams.
It is a classic money grabbing scam, fun in the beginning than later on pay to progress....Skip it
Bleeds mobile game in every corner. Does not feel good to control on the pc. Pacing feels off. It's not fun.
The theme is cool and it looks great, but the developer constantly trying to trick you into paying felt predatory and gross.

I have had fun playing this cute little game. Until recently with the "reality reboot" update.  With the update none of the existing issues were fixed and all new issues were added. Some basic game features are not simply broken.
In its current state I would not recommend this to anyone.
Predatory freemium game, avoid like the plague.
Idle game. Normally I'd say free games are always worth a try, but something like this isn't even worth your time. If you like idle games you'll probably like this, though. It's a decent one.

the reality reboot update nerfed the game to the ground, stay away from it if you value some sort of progress.
im glad i finished the game before the update.

I bought a bundle to support the devs who made the game. I went to go save the game but I loaded a save from an hour before I had spent the money and when I went to go and reload my game to where I just was there was no option. This game is dog**** and if the developers can't even make a proper localization system then they're hopeless. **** you guys
Wait this one is sorta cool. I think it was funny that all the music played were like songs Iâ€™ve played in orchestra / band. Still just an idler at the same of the day though.

I tried this game for a few minutes but the game ends up flashing these strange patterns every 30 seconds or so and it breaks all the text and numbers so they are unreadable. The game is essentially unplayable.

Recommend everyone skip this one.
What is the point of this, their challenges take hours to do and you just have to sit there clicking

This was a pretty fun afk game when i first played.
A bit pretentious in how they make you watch 3s cutscenes for everything you click, every time you click.
But the new update single-handedly pushed the game to being impossible to play without giving them money constantly.
Your game is not fun enough to pay for, GL.

Do yourself a solid favour, by not playing this game. It will waste your time and attention, while giving very little in return. At a certain point, you must realise that you would be paying money to avoid wasting your own time - Why not just stop playing then you get your time back and keep your money?

The competitive mode is Pay To Win (P2W), and the other modes are intentionally stretched-out to allow the developer to sell you the solution.

This plays like a mobile game- Oh wait.
weird game

mid
ðŸ–•

Despite the many hours I spent playing this I finally gave up on it because of how predatory this game is. 

First you have four different singularities (idles) in one.
1. Main covering organic life and human tech
2. Prehistoric times with dinosaurs
3. Planetary system
4. Competitive clicking for 2-3 days

The main one is meant to be done relatively quickly and by done I mean getting most of the idles and boosters unlocked and the only thing after that makes it long is just how many times you have to repeat it to achieve the over all run boosters. That's to be expected in a idle game

The second and third share similar traits in that their boosters can only be improved by getting ranks of them from lil loot box equivalents. So whichever dinosaur or planet you want to expedite isn't really guaranteed because of needing to get the luck to get the ranks and THEN you need a resource to buy the rank up after having enough ranks added to the overall level of the booster. Sure, that's fine. That's not usual from what I know about idle games but it's still a nice bonus since you're still getting boosters.

Then there's the fourth singularity. I'd call it the 'competition of the week' but it's actually 2-3 days. In order to get anything meaningful from these you pretty much need to work on this one (or run the PC on with an autoclicker) very often. The only real rewards come from getting a higher position in the competitive ranking and most of the top 100 if not more tend to just use their currency to boost or, even better, buy their way into the top ranks. 

And then there's the mechanic where there are golden objects flying around the screen. They seem harmless and even beneficial at first. Up until you get one that tells you to spend your currency to get the bonus instead or just skip it. There's even a third option saying you can get the 30 day pass to make these purchases easy by spending some money to make small purchases of in game currency like this free for those 30 days.  They even have a daily sign in bonus where you get that for 15 minutes so for people who weren't wanting to spend money get that taste of fully boosting their singularities to a full 24 hour and X4 productivity. This creates so much more incentive to buy into their artificial difficulty in an idle game. It's free only for the fact that you can watch numbers go up to a small enough degree that it tantalizes the idea of spending money to make the numbers go faster. 

Once I had physically told about these mechanics to someone the other night I had only realized that I had less fun with this game because of these mechanics and decided to give up on it then and there.
Game begs you to spend money at every turn. Even has the gall to ask you to boost when logging off, which costs premium currency.

I got to play this before the 11/18/2025 purge

Game was very fun and addicting. 

And then the purge happened.

- Cubes to unlock things no longer spawn and replaced by other things 
- Number system was replaced from Million and Trillion to the stupid roblox style of numbers "Aa Ab Ac" 
- Progress was reset in main map so you have to unlock everything again. Option to stay on your original main map if you want but who will do that... 

Feels like developer took a "how to monitize your game" class and started bleeding our pennys from us. Even gave us a free limited time upgrade to x2 what we earn only to have it end in a few days and try to force us to buy more out of feeling slow. 

Just killed your game. Bye~ 

PS no reason to respond to this Mr Developer. You will say a lot of "We feel sorry you feel this way but can earn unlock cubes in many new and exciting ways!" Don't bother. We see right through your new scams.

Game is good, sorta educational, progression is fairly fast paced, classical music is playing in the background, though list of music is short and gets bit annoying after a while. So why negative? Everything I said is true only for primary simulation. For rest game is on mobile and it shows. You have a dino and space simulations, both have lootbox cards that slow your progression to a crawl, with space its even worse due to clicking providing miniscule gains. Events are pain to complete and you'll have to do it cos you will need augmentations they award for permanent upgrades in dino and space. Oh, and there is only 1 for dino, but at least its decent, for space its 10 separate expensive upgrades that work only on specific planets. Also link your acc to phone to view ads(ofc each ad requires to be closed 3 to 5 times) to gain to get an extra boost, you wont be given enough darvinium(go look up the codes online for those). I decided to not write reviews till I 100% a game(I know Im mentally ill, no need to point that out), but things are crystal clear for me already. If you want to play for like a day and dont care about game screwing your achievements stats go ahead. If you do care though, avoid like fire, otherwise you'll be on a tedious and lengthy quest of completing game, with one achievement requiring you to log for 84 days to get all sharks. Devs absolutely butchered their game and have absolutely no respect for you dear customer, so dont be shy of using any means necessary to get done with this game ass soon as possible
long way to addictive boring and predatory to get you to s[pend money
It is a classic money grabbing scam, fun in the beginning than later on pay to progress....Skip it

Riddled with mtx in order to progress at a decent pace, otherwise it just takes forever... there's a very slow sense of progress, unlike good clicker idler games where you're rewarded every now and then

Not very fun, while i'm not sure what I expected going in but a mobile game is certainly not that, requires massive afk time and when you are actually playing the game just loads you up with dopamine to keep you into it. If you want a good idol game, that does the same and is just made better go play Cookie Clicker or is you want a true idol game go play My Singing Monsters or Clash of Clans
the main game is great BUT the new reboot sucks its mest up all my stuff and its very diff to understand the main game is way better

Clickers (that don't enable mouse holding) Suck, Back-Up Saves occur every half-hour (which is terrible for any game, should be 10 minutes max) and swapping too quickly to a different screen can completely reset progress from the last screen to the last autosave (which, again, occurs only every half-hour)

Sadly, its a bad clicker.
The visuals are good, but it took +100 hs to be completed. totally unnecessary,

5/10
Trash idle game designed to extract the most money possible. 10/10 would tell anyone to not waste their time on this game. There are much better idle games.

imagine grinding for hours and buying upgrades and receive no sense of progress. ya, way to many useless upgrades. too few worth while upgrades. and the few that exist require many repetitive reset grinds. 
i like a well balances idle and clicker game. unfortunately, this one is not well balanced. even when it gives free pay to progress faster boosts. numbers dont go up, brain no go brrrrr.

If you stop the process that throws the Bonus sprites at the cursor I'll change my Review to a Yes. As it stands I cannot recommend because of this feature. Great game for learning some generic things about animals, bad at respecting player time and commitment.
Bleeds mobile game in every corner. Does not feel good to control on the pc. Pacing feels off. It's not fun.
The theme is cool and it looks great, but the developer constantly trying to trick you into paying felt predatory and gross.

I have had fun playing this cute little game. Until recently with the "reality reboot" update.  With the update none of the existing issues were fixed and all new issues were added. Some basic game features are not simply broken.
In its current state I would not recommend this to anyone.

The devs just added new achievements and removed the debug mode so we couldn't get them as easily as before.

This was a pretty fun afk game when i first played.
A bit pretentious in how they make you watch 3s cutscenes for everything you click, every time you click.
But the new update single-handedly pushed the game to being impossible to play without giving them money constantly.
Your game is not fun enough to pay for, GL.

Do yourself a solid favour, by not playing this game. It will waste your time and attention, while giving very little in return. At a certain point, you must realise that you would be paying money to avoid wasting your own time - Why not just stop playing then you get your time back and keep your money?

The competitive mode is Pay To Win (P2W), and the other modes are intentionally stretched-out to allow the developer to sell you the solution.

ðŸ–•

Despite the many hours I spent playing this I finally gave up on it because of how predatory this game is. 

First you have four different singularities (idles) in one.
1. Main covering organic life and human tech
2. Prehistoric times with dinosaurs
3. Planetary system
4. Competitive clicking for 2-3 days

The main one is meant to be done relatively quickly and by done I mean getting most of the idles and boosters unlocked and the only thing after that makes it long is just how many times you have to repeat it to achieve the over all run boosters. That's to be expected in a idle game

The second and third share similar traits in that their boosters can only be improved by getting ranks of them from lil loot box equivalents. So whichever dinosaur or planet you want to expedite isn't really guaranteed because of needing to get the luck to get the ranks and THEN you need a resource to buy the rank up after having enough ranks added to the overall level of the booster. Sure, that's fine. That's not usual from what I know about idle games but it's still a nice bonus since you're still getting boosters.

Then there's the fourth singularity. I'd call it the 'competition of the week' but it's actually 2-3 days. In order to get anything meaningful from these you pretty much need to work on this one (or run the PC on with an autoclicker) very often. The only real rewards come from getting a higher position in the competitive ranking and most of the top 100 if not more tend to just use their currency to boost or, even better, buy their way into the top ranks. 

And then there's the mechanic where there are golden objects flying around the screen. They seem harmless and even beneficial at first. Up until you get one that tells you to spend your currency to get the bonus instead or just skip it. There's even a third option saying you can get the 30 day pass to make these purchases easy by spending some money to make small purchases of in game currency like this free for those 30 days.  They even have a daily sign in bonus where you get that for 15 minutes so for people who weren't wanting to spend money get that taste of fully boosting their singularities to a full 24 hour and X4 productivity. This creates so much more incentive to buy into their artificial difficulty in an idle game. It's free only for the fact that you can watch numbers go up to a small enough degree that it tantalizes the idea of spending money to make the numbers go faster. 

Once I had physically told about these mechanics to someone the other night I had only realized that I had less fun with this game because of these mechanics and decided to give up on it then and there.
Game begs you to spend money at every turn. Even has the gall to ask you to boost when logging off, which costs premium currency.

I got to play this before the 11/18/2025 purge

Game was very fun and addicting. 

And then the purge happened.

- Cubes to unlock things no longer spawn and replaced by other things 
- Number system was replaced from Million and Trillion to the stupid roblox style of numbers "Aa Ab Ac" 
- Progress was reset in main map so you have to unlock everything again. Option to stay on your original main map if you want but who will do that... 

Feels like developer took a "how to monitize your game" class and started bleeding our pennys from us. Even gave us a free limited time upgrade to x2 what we earn only to have it end in a few days and try to force us to buy more out of feeling slow. 

Just killed your game. Bye~ 

PS no reason to respond to this Mr Developer. You will say a lot of "We feel sorry you feel this way but can earn unlock cubes in many new and exciting ways!" Don't bother. We see right through your new scams.

Game is good, sorta educational, progression is fairly fast paced, classical music is playing in the background, though list of music is short and gets bit annoying after a while. So why negative? Everything I said is true only for primary simulation. For rest game is on mobile and it shows. You have a dino and space simulations, both have lootbox cards that slow your progression to a crawl, with space its even worse due to clicking providing miniscule gains. Events are pain to complete and you'll have to do it cos you will need augmentations they award for permanent upgrades in dino and space. Oh, and there is only 1 for dino, but at least its decent, for space its 10 separate expensive upgrades that work only on specific planets. Also link your acc to phone to view ads(ofc each ad requires to be closed 3 to 5 times) to gain to get an extra boost, you wont be given enough darvinium(go look up the codes online for those). I decided to not write reviews till I 100% a game(I know Im mentally ill, no need to point that out), but things are crystal clear for me already. If you want to play for like a day and dont care about game screwing your achievements stats go ahead. If you do care though, avoid like fire, otherwise you'll be on a tedious and lengthy quest of completing game, with one achievement requiring you to log for 84 days to get all sharks. Devs absolutely butchered their game and have absolutely no respect for you dear customer, so dont be shy of using any means necessary to get done with this game ass soon as possible
long way to addictive boring and predatory to get you to s[pend money
It is a classic money grabbing scam, fun in the beginning than later on pay to progress....Skip it

Riddled with mtx in order to progress at a decent pace, otherwise it just takes forever... there's a very slow sense of progress, unlike good clicker idler games where you're rewarded every now and then

Not very fun, while i'm not sure what I expected going in but a mobile game is certainly not that, requires massive afk time and when you are actually playing the game just loads you up with dopamine to keep you into it. If you want a good idol game, that does the same and is just made better go play Cookie Clicker or is you want a true idol game go play My Singing Monsters or Clash of Clans
the main game is great BUT the new reboot sucks its mest up all my stuff and its very diff to understand the main game is way better

Clickers (that don't enable mouse holding) Suck, Back-Up Saves occur every half-hour (which is terrible for any game, should be 10 minutes max) and swapping too quickly to a different screen can completely reset progress from the last screen to the last autosave (which, again, occurs only every half-hour)

Sadly, its a bad clicker.
The visuals are good, but it took +100 hs to be completed. totally unnecessary,

5/10
Trash idle game designed to extract the most money possible. 10/10 would tell anyone to not waste their time on this game. There are much better idle games.

imagine grinding for hours and buying upgrades and receive no sense of progress. ya, way to many useless upgrades. too few worth while upgrades. and the few that exist require many repetitive reset grinds. 
i like a well balances idle and clicker game. unfortunately, this one is not well balanced. even when it gives free pay to progress faster boosts. numbers dont go up, brain no go brrrrr.

If you stop the process that throws the Bonus sprites at the cursor I'll change my Review to a Yes. As it stands I cannot recommend because of this feature. Great game for learning some generic things about animals, bad at respecting player time and commitment.
Bleeds mobile game in every corner. Does not feel good to control on the pc. Pacing feels off. It's not fun.
The theme is cool and it looks great, but the developer constantly trying to trick you into paying felt predatory and gross.

I have had fun playing this cute little game. Until recently with the "reality reboot" update.  With the update none of the existing issues were fixed and all new issues were added. Some basic game features are not simply broken.
In its current state I would not recommend this to anyone.

The devs just added new achievements and removed the debug mode so we couldn't get them as easily as before.
I miss the times when I was able to 100% a game without having to worry about It getting new achievements years later.
